body.class: home page-template page-template-frontpage page-template-frontpage-php page page-id-29 onepage

div.div: Ziff Davis, a subsidiary of j2 Global, Inc., is a leading global digital-media company operating in three core verticals: Technology, Gaming, and Shopping. Its brands – PCMag, Mashable, Speedtest, ExtremeTech, Geek, Toolbox, IGN, AskMen, Offers.com, TechBargains, emedia and Salesify – produce and distribute premium content across multiple platforms and devices. Ziff Davis delivers advertising, performance marketing, data services and licensing solutions to thousands of clients worldwide. Ziff Davis publishes in 25 languages and successfully partners with local publishing operators across 114 countries.
Q3 2017, Sources: YouTube, Social Platforms, Google Analytics

div.p: Ziff now serves at the epitome of modern, innovating digital publishing

img.alt: MarTech Advisor, HR Technologist and ReadITQuik become part of the Ziff Davis Family

a.h4: How Ziff Davis survived the death of print

div.div:
As President, Steve Horowitz oversees all aspects of Ziff Davis including the five business units – Ziff Davis Tech & Commerce; IGN; Ookla; Ziff Davis B2B; and Ziff Davis International. Steve will continue to assist Everyday Health businesses in their development and strategy, as well as and be a key member of the j2 corporate leadership team.
Horowitz was formerly Senior Vice President, General Manager at Bankrate Inc., the leading aggregator of personal finance and mortgage content. At Bankrate, he directed product and business strategy and spearheaded the portal’s transformation into one of the leading destinations that allowed consumers to research and purchase consumer financial products, ranging from mortgages to deposit products to credit cards.
Prior to Bankrate, Horowitz served as Vice President of e-commerce classifieds at AOL and held director positions in business and sales strategy for classifieds and local properties with Yahoo! and GeoCities. He also served as Associate Director of internet marketing for BMG Music Club (Bertelsmann), Director of Internet Venues at eDrive.com and as Online Publicist for Turner Entertainment Group at Turner Broadcasting Systems, Inc.
Horowitz received a Bachelor of Arts degree with a major in English from the State University of New York at Oswego.

Brian Stewart joined Ziff Davis as Chief Financial Officer in March 2015. He has extensive experience as in media and finance, most recently as CFO of Encompass Digital Media, a private equity owned company providing video management and distribution services to cable and broadcast networks.
Prior to that, Brian was CFO of Crown Media Holdings, Inc, a public company operating cable programming networks. Brian also held various finance positions at Hallmark Entertainment, Univision, Hallmark Cards, Inc, and Ernest and Young. He holds a B.S. from the University of Kansas and an MBA from the University of Chicago.

As Chief Strategy Officer, Jimmy Yaffe oversees M&A, strategy and monetization across our portfolio of digital brands.
Yaffe co-founded FUEL:M+C (Media + Commerce), an early stage investor in digital media and commerce companies, including Maker Studios (sold to Disney), Bureau of Trade (sold to Ebay), and StyleSaint. Previously, Yaffe was a partner in Terry Semel’s Windsor Media, which made investments in Square, Jagex and Scopley, among others.
Yaffe helped start the corporate consulting practice at the Endeavor Talent Agency. He also led Endeavor’s media and technology practice and expanded platform and content development opportunities with artists and corporate clients. James started his career at BBDO in New York.
James is currently on the Board of The Yaffe Center for Persuasive Communications at the University of Michigan. He received a Bachelor of Arts degree in economics, marketing and communications from the University of Michigan, where he was also the captain of the golf team.

Since February 2009 Hicks has served as General Counsel and Corporate Secretary for Ziff Davis, LLC. and its predecessor. Hicks is co-chair of the Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB) legal affairs committee.
Prior to joining Ziff Davis, Hicks served as General Counsel and Secretary for: MTM Technologies Inc. a publicly traded IT services provider and product reseller; OutlookSoft Corp. a VC backed international financial software corporation acquired by SAP; and AMICAS Inc. (formerly VitalWorks) a publicly traded medical software corporation.
Hicks also worked on the executive staff of Dennis Vacco, the New York State Attorney General; and was an associate at a New York law firm.

p.span: I have been working with Ziff Davis for over 7 years where I started my career as a front end developer for PCMag.com. I have advanced in my career here and was recently promoted to Engineering Manager. It’s a great place to work and improve your skills, and management encourages you to learn new technologies every day. Ziff Davis has a dynamic and energizing environment that will inspire, challenge, and excite you as you develop your career along with your talented colleagues.

li.div: — Swetha | Engineering Manager | New York, NY —

p.span: Working at AskMen has been unlike an experience I’ve had in my professional career. I still remember my first day. The team applauded when I walked into my first editorial meeting. That’s just how welcoming everyone was. I’ve worked in the New York office for more than two years now. My position has constantly been evolving, which has been a great opportunity for me to learn. We have a small team and there’s a feeling of family here, even with much of AskMen’s edit staff based in Montreal. It’s really a unique place to work.

li.div: — Christopher | Editor At Large | New York, NY —

p.span: It has been an exciting one and half years working at Ookla. I love that we are a very unique company in which every employee has ownership and passion for what they do, and the impact it has on our products and business. I was empowered and trusted by my manager and team to drive results from day one, and have had incredibly rewarding experiences since. Every day, I happily start my work day knowing that I will learn new things, face new challenges and continue to grow. It’s a pure delight to work with a group of smart and fun people who have enriched me both personally and professionally.

li.div: — Di | Program Manager | San Francisco, CA —

p.span: I’ve been working in the London office for seven years and no two days have ever been alike. My role has continued to grow as I continue to learn, experience and work with new areas of the business almost daily. Most importantly, however, is that my career is progressing at lightning speed and I’m having a huge amount of fun as it does.

li.div: — Dan | Director of Marketing and Product | London, UK —

p.span: emedia is home, when I was exploring my next career opportunity I knew I was looking for somewhere I could call home. Somewhere I could not only make money but also grow both personally and professionally. I have been with emedia for the past year and a half and I can say without a doubt I’ve found my home. Every day presents a new opportunity and challenge; there’s never a dull moment. Not everyone can say they enjoy coming to work every day, but I’m glad I finally can.

li.div: — Ashley | Inside Sales Representative | Chicago, IL —

p.span: I get to come to the office every day and work in a lab surrounded by the latest technology, some of which the rest of the world hasn’t even seen yet. The team takes testing and reviewing tech seriously, but knows how to have fun while doing it. From our spirited morning news meetings to daily video shows, there’s always a feeling of excitement and camaraderie at PCMag.

li.div: — Jonathan | Managing Editor, Hardware | New York, NY —

p.span: I’ve been working for Offers.com for nearly six years, and it’s been amazing to watch this company evolve and grow into a leader in our space. The brilliant people I’ve met, exciting experiences I’ve had in my role, and unexpected things I’ve learned along the way have provided me a work environment I get excited to be a part of every day. Things are ever-changing which makes this company an inspiring place to work. Can’t wait to see what our team accomplishes next!

I like working at emedia because of the people. Everyone is super helpful and goes out of their way to make sure you have what you need to do your job. We’re a close-knit little group here and it shows; everyone wants to see everyone flourish.

li.div: — Elliot | Inside Sales Representative | Chicago, IL —

p.span: PCMag is a place where I can look forward to the unique challenges and opportunities that each day brings. The guidance and encouragement offered by my co-workers has presented me with fantastic learning opportunities, and expanded the possibilities of what I know we can accomplish together. Our team recognizes and rewards the efforts put forth by every individual, and fosters creativity. PCMag maintains a proud legacy of independence and constant personal growth. I consider myself fortunate to have the opportunity to be a part of that and share my experience with such a talented and dedicated group of people.

li.div: — Alice | Inventory Control Coordinator | New York, NY —

p.span: Every day is different as a writer at PCMag.com and that’s what has made me love each one for the six years I’ve been here. I get to write about social issues, interview actors and directors, attend New York Fashion Week, and experience technology before it becomes available. There is no other job that could fit so closely with my interests in life and still continue to inspire me every day like this one does.

li.div: — Chandra | Senior Features Writer | New York, NY —

ul.li: Medical, dental, and vision insurance plans for employees, families, and domestic partners
Country-specific pension plan for our international employees
Disability and life insurance coverage fully paid for by the company
Casual work environment and dress code
Transit benefits for our public transportation commuters
